RT @fernhilldammit: @LeighNaturkach My philanthropic year: @AbortionRights @oxfamcanada @Interval_House @DailyBreadTO @StStephensHouse @Tor…

The marches, petitions, protests and community events I have been inspired by and those I have been involved with give me the fuel needed to continue onward in the year ahead. Sending big love to those organizers and galvanizers. Your work is invaluable!
I’d love to hear what other people supported - philanthropy can look like many things - time, wisdom, energy, networks, and more.

It’s been wonderful to see the work of these organizations and individuals move the dial on issues and topics important to me, my values, our communities, and equity. Here’s to more support for each and the great minds and hearts behind them in 2019!

My philanthropic year: @wchf @DWDCanada ArrabonHouse @actioncanadashr @AbortionRights @HBKidsHospital @Caringsociety @CLEWcanada @AWHL @AlzCanada @CanadasLifeline @aclu @MsMagazine @guardian Society of Sharing @anne_theriault Steph Guthrie @TiffanyFordTO @m_layton @kristynwongtam

My google search history is real grim.

New acquaintance: “So what do you recommend in Edinburgh?”
Me: “Oh man there’s a wallet made of human skin, from that famous murderer, William Burke, at the Surgeons’ Hall Museums. Simon Pegg played him in that movie!”
Acquaintance: 😳
Me: “Or, Arthur’s Seat’s cool too.”
